column4: any opengl programmers? i'm trying to install mesa so i can write opengl programs, but i don't know which package to get.
What graphic chipset are you using?
That's not part of GL; apt-get install openglut-dev
So I don't need Mesa?
If it asks for glut.h, I guess you already have the other OpenGL headers. They were probably included when you installed the ATI drivers.
I can't find opengl_dev in Synaptic
I do however have some Mesa packages.
Do you have xlibmesa-gl-dev?
yes.
That folder may be elsewhere
'locate' comes up with nothing.
Ihave /usr/include/GL, which contains links from /usr/X11R6/include/GL/
Should I install that Mesa package?
Sounds like something wrong with your filesystem if the package is there, but the haeders are gone
Reinstall the xlibmesa-gl-dev package, then
I haven't installed it yet. :-)  I thought you meant if I could see it in Synaptic ... which I can.
No, I meant do you *currently* have it ;)
Oh.  Then no. :-)
Then it's like I said first - just install that
So that's the package to get then?
It should be
OK thanks.  I'll try it.
Get xlibmesa-dev, xlibmesa-gl-dev, xlibmesa-glu-dev
That was exactly what I was looking for.  Thanks.
